marklogic.body:
I liked what this episode did for JEFF. The writers had really painted themselves into a corner with the character. They had Hayley marry him for the two-parter episode as a ratings stunt... then got stuck with a guy whose entire persona is Burning Man Stoner Hippie, making him pretty useless as a plot driver. And this led to Hayley going underused, since now you can't bring her into the action without also something for Jeff to do.
But this episode could lead to a new direction. The writers should keep going with establishing Jeff as a lower-class but hardworking guy, trying to do what's right for his wife and himself. He'll never be remotely as insane as everyone else, but at least he can be a useful straight man for the others to play Off (as he was here), and some political conflict between Jeff and Stan could work too. They should establish his shtick as "I need to work because I'm broke", which could lead to funny tangles with Roger's schemes or CIA business.
